SEARCH
Package ca.jolt.routing.context

Class JoltHttpContext

java.lang.Object
ca.jolt.routing.context.JoltHttpContext
public final class JoltHttpContext extends Object
Provides an HTTP context object that encapsulates request and response handling within the Jolt framework. It includes utility methods for:
  • Retrieving path parameters, query parameters, headers, and the raw request body.
  • Parsing JSON request bodies into Java objects.
  • Building and adding cookies to responses.
  • Returning text, JSON, or HTML responses.
  • Constructing Form objects from query parameters or the request body.

Usage Example : 


 get("/user/{id:int}", ctx -> ctx.html("Hi user #" + ctx.path("id").asInt()));
Since:
1.0
Author:
William Beaudin
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • JoltHttpContext

      public JoltHttpContext(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res, Matcher pathMatcher, List<String> paramNames)
      Constructs a JoltHttpContext with the specified request, response, path parameter matcher, and parameter names.
      Parameters:
      req - The underlying HttpServletRequest.
      res - The underlying HttpServletResponse.
      pathMatcher - A Matcher used to extract path parameters from the URL based on a route pattern.
      paramNames - The list of named parameters extracted from the route definition.

  • Method Details

    • getRequest

      public jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest getRequest()
      Returns the raw HttpServletRequest object for lower-level access.
      Returns:
      The raw servlet request.

    • method

      public String method()
      Retrieves the HTTP method (e.g., GET, POST, PUT) of the current request.
      Returns:
      A string representing the HTTP method.

    • requestPath

      public String requestPath()
      Retrieves the request path (e.g., "/users/123"). It checks HttpServletRequest.getPathInfo() and falls back to HttpServletRequest.getServletPath() if getPathInfo() is null.
      Returns:
      The normalized request path, never empty.

    • path

      public PathContextValue path(String name)
      Returns a PathContextValue for a named path parameter.

      For example, if the route is "/user/{id:int}" and the request path is "/user/42", calling ctx.path("id").asInt() would return "42".

      Parameters:
      name - The name of the path parameter.
      Returns:
      A PathContextValue (wrapping an optional string).

    • query

      public QueryContextValue query(String name)
      Returns a QueryContextValue for a named query parameter.

      If no query parameter with that name exists, this will wrap an empty optional.

      Parameters:
      name - The name of the query parameter.
      Returns:
      A QueryContextValue object.

    • query

      public Map<String,List<String>> query()
      Returns a map of all query parameters, where each key is the parameter name and the value is a list of strings (e.g., multiple values for the same parameter).
      Returns:
      A map of query parameters, possibly empty if no query parameters exist.

    • bearerToken

      public Optional<String> bearerToken()
      Retrieves the bearer token from the HTTP context.

      This method attempts to extract the bearer token from the HTTP request headers. The bearer token is typically used for authentication and authorization purposes.

      The method returns an Optional containing the bearer token if it is present in the request headers. If the bearer token is not found, an empty Optional is returned.

      Returns:
      an Optional containing the bearer token if present, otherwise an empty Optional

    • bodyRaw

      public String bodyRaw()
      Reads and returns the raw request body as a string. If reading the body fails, a JoltBadRequestException is thrown.
      Returns:
      The raw request body content as a string.
      Throws:
      JoltBadRequestException - If an I/O error occurs while reading.

    • body

      public <T> T body(Class<T> type)
      Parses the request body as JSON into an object of type T.

      Returns null if the raw body is empty.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type into which the JSON should be deserialized.
      Parameters:
      type - A Class object for the target type.
      Returns:
      The deserialized object, or null if empty.
      Throws:
      JoltBadRequestException - If parsing fails.

    • body

      public <T> T body(com.fasterxml.jackson.core.type.TypeReference<T> typeRef)
      Parses the request body as JSON into an object using a Jackson TypeReference.

      Returns null if the raw body is empty.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type corresponding to the TypeReference.
      Parameters:
      typeRef - A TypeReference describing the target type.
      Returns:
      The deserialized object, or null if empty.
      Throws:
      JoltBadRequestException - If parsing fails.

    • getFiles

      public List<JoltFile> getFiles()
      Returns a list of all uploaded files as JoltFile objects, storing file data in memory. It also automatically filters out empty files. If the request isn't multipart, returns an empty list or throws an exception as needed.
      Returns:
      Listinvalid input: '<'JoltFile> of JoltFile objects.

    • header

      public String header(String n)
      Retrieves a specified HTTP header value from the request.
      Parameters:
      n - The name of the header.
      Returns:
      The header value, or null if it does not exist.

    • getResponse

      public jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse getResponse()
      Returns the raw HttpServletResponse object for lower-level access.
      Returns:
      The raw servlet response.

    • status

      public JoltHttpContext status(HttpStatus status)
      Sets the HTTP status code on the response using a HttpStatus enum constant.
      Parameters:
      status - The HttpStatus to set on the response.
      Returns:
      This JoltHttpContext, for fluent chaining.

    • status

      public JoltHttpContext status(int code)
      Sets the HTTP status code on the response directly using an int.
      Parameters:
      code - The numeric status code (e.g., 200, 404).
      Returns:
      This JoltHttpContext, for fluent chaining.

    • header

      public JoltHttpContext header(String name, String value)
      Sets a header on the response.
      Parameters:
      name - The header name.
      value - The header value.
      Returns:
      This JoltHttpContext, for fluent chaining.

    • redirect

      public JoltHttpContext redirect(String location)
      Redirect's the response to a new existing location.
      Parameters:
      location - The new location to redirect to.
      Returns:
      This JoltHttpContext, for fluent chaining.

    • redirect

      public JoltHttpContext redirect(String location, Runnable redirectedRoute)
      Redirect's the response to the newly created resource.
      Parameters:
      location - The newly created resource.
      redirectedRoute - The newly created resource's route.
      Returns:
      This JoltHttpContext, for fluent chaining.

    • text

      public JoltHttpContext text(String data)
      Writes a plain-text response.

      Sets the Content-Type to "text/plain;charset=UTF-8".

      Parameters:
      data - The text to write.
      Returns:
      This JoltHttpContext, for fluent chaining.
      Throws:
      JoltHttpException - If an I/O error occurs while writing.

    • json

      public JoltHttpContext json(Map<String,Object> json)
      Writes a JSON response using a Map.

      Sets the Content-Type to "application/json;charset=UTF-8".

      Parameters:
      json - A Map to serialize as JSON.
      Returns:
      This JoltHttpContext, for fluent chaining.
      Throws:
      JoltHttpException - If an I/O error occurs while writing.

    • json

      public JoltHttpContext json(Object data)
      Writes a JSON response from any Java object (POJO, List, etc.).

      Sets the Content-Type to "application/json;charset=UTF-8".

      Parameters:
      data - The Java object to serialize as JSON.
      Returns:
      This JoltHttpContext, for fluent chaining.
      Throws:
      JoltHttpException - If an I/O error occurs while writing.

    • html

      public JoltHttpContext html(String html)
      Writes an HTML response.

      Sets the Content-Type to "text/html;charset=UTF-8".

      Parameters:
      html - The HTML content to write.
      Returns:
      This JoltHttpContext, for fluent chaining.
      Throws:
      JoltHttpException - If an I/O error occurs while writing.

    • serve

      public JoltHttpContext serve(String resource)
      Serves a static file from the "/static" directory located in the classpath.

      For example, ctx.serve("index.html") will try to locate the resource at "resources/static/index.html" and write its contents to the response with an appropriate MIME type.

      Parameters:
      resource - the file name to serve (e.g., "index.html" or "image.png")
      Returns:
      this JoltHttpContext for fluent chaining.

    • abort

      public void abort(HttpStatus status, String message)
      Aborts the request with a specified HTTP status and message. Sets the response status and writes the message as plain text.
      Parameters:
      status - The HTTP status to set.
      message - The message to write.
      Throws:
      JoltHttpException - If writing the response fails.

    • abortBadRequest

      public void abortBadRequest(String message)
      Aborts the request with 400 Bad Request status.
      Parameters:
      message - The error message to send
      Throws:
      JoltHttpException - If writing the response fails

    • abortNotFound

      public void abortNotFound(String message)
      Aborts the request with 404 Not Found status.
      Parameters:
      message - The error message to send
      Throws:
      JoltHttpException - If writing the response fails

    • abortInternalServerError

      public void abortInternalServerError(String message)
      Aborts the request with 500 Internal Server Error status.
      Parameters:
      message - The error message to send
      Throws:
      JoltHttpException - If writing the response fails

    • abortUnauthorized

      public void abortUnauthorized(String message)
      Aborts the request with 401 Unauthorized status.
      Parameters:
      message - The error message to send
      Throws:
      JoltHttpException - If writing the response fails

    • abortForbidden

      public void abortForbidden(String message)
      Aborts the request with 403 Forbidden status.
      Parameters:
      message - The error message to send
      Throws:
      JoltHttpException - If writing the response fails

    • getCookie

      public jakarta.servlet.http.Cookie getCookie(String name)
      Retrieves a cookie from the request by name.
      Parameters:
      name - The cookie name to look up.
      Returns:
      The matching Cookie, or null if not found.

    • getSessionCookie

      public jakarta.servlet.http.Cookie getSessionCookie()
      Retrieves the session cookie from the current context.

      Delegates to getCookie(String) to fetch the cookie identified by the "session" key, typically used to manage user session state.

      Returns:
      The Cookie object representing the session cookie, or null if no such cookie exists.

    • getJwtToken

      public jakarta.servlet.http.Cookie getJwtToken()
      Retrieves the JWT token cookie from the current context.

      Delegates to getCookie(String) to fetch the cookie identified by the "jwt_token" key, typically used to store a JSON Web Token for authentication.

      Returns:
      The Cookie object representing the JWT token cookie, or null if no such cookie exists.

    • addCookie

      public CookieBuilder addCookie()
      Returns a CookieBuilder preconfigured to attach cookies to this response.

      Example: 

      
 ctx.addCookie()
         .setName("sessionId")
         .setValue("abc123")
         .httpOnly(true)
         .build();
      Returns:
      A new CookieBuilder for building and adding cookies.

    • getCookies

      public List<jakarta.servlet.http.Cookie> getCookies()
      Returns a list of all cookies present in the request.
      Returns:
      A list of cookies, or an empty list if none are present.

    • removeCookie

      public JoltHttpContext removeCookie(String name)
      Removes (expires) a cookie by name by setting its maxAge to 0 and re-adding it to the response.
      Parameters:
      name - The cookie name to remove.
      Returns:
      This JoltHttpContext, for fluent chaining.

    • buildForm

      public Form buildForm(String... excludes)
      Builds a new Form by aggregating data from all available sources:
      • Query parameters (or form-encoded parameters)
      • JSON request body (if the Content-Type is "application/json")
      • Path parameters extracted from the URL
      In case of duplicate keys, the values from later sources (e.g. JSON body or path parameters) will override those from earlier sources.
      Parameters:
      excludes - The name of the fields to exclude from the form.
      Returns:
      A new Form instance populated with all available input data.
      Throws:
      JoltBadRequestException - If JSON parsing fails.
